pci_databases_backups_fork_description: Your backup fork will be run on a new cluster.
pci_databases_backups_fork_nodes_input_l: Select the number of nodes in the cluster
pci_databases_backups_fork_network_mode_: The solution selected is not compatible with public networks.
The solution selected is not compatible with private networks.
pci_databases_backups_fork_privateNetwor: Only the services (dedicated servers, VMs, K8s clusters, etc.) connected to this private network (vRack) can communicate with your database.
pci_databases_backups_fork_subnet_descri: You can create a subnet, but you will lose your current configuration.
pci_databases_backups_fork_create_databa: Your service has been successfully forked. It is being created, and will be available in a few minutes.
An error occurred while creating your service. Please try the operation again later: {{message}}

pci_databases_backups_fork_spec_name_pop: The name of your cluster is automatically generated. You can change it later.
pci_databases_backups_fork_network_mode_: To find out more about configuring a private network, view the guide: {{link}}
The public network enables connections from any authorised source IP connected to the internet (your computer, a remote server, etc.)
The private network does not allow public connectivity, and only allows connections from within your vRack.
pci_databases_backups_fork_storage_sizin: The {{flavorName}} node model includes {{includedStorage}} storage, to which you can add up to {{addableStorage}} of additional storage in increments of {{step}}.
pci_databases_backups_fork_restore_mode_: Select the restore point from which the service will be duplicated.
